Message.Title: Sybil is frustrated.
Message.Msg: She could have closed her AMZN short position last week with a few dimes of profits. Now, she's back deeply in the red again. And that is after waiting for almost 5 months! But Sybil has fared better than Techstrategy. Techstrategy has been completely out of this game for a few months. All of his options, including INTC calls, near worthless and he has no more money to "adjust" the strike prices of his options. Needless to say, his has no morale left either. He just talks.

That's funny because when was the last time they brought real profits to the bottom line. Bezos himself has made more money selling the stock than the company has made in profits. What a surprise, NOT! Lots of headwinds against this company, each quarter more and more pressure on pricing due to competition and state taxes having to be paid. The competition will become even better for consumers as AMZN is actually held accountable for their earnings, or lack there of I should say. The perpetual we are building for the future nonsense eventually won't be good enough. They'll love it until they hate it and this is starting to look toppy. Let's see what this Q's rev and earnings look lie and let's see how the cartel reacts to the report.
Not really, dummy... But you can keep imagining if you want,.... Its quite facinating, actually.

Message.Title: Another AAPLtrage save...
Message.Msg: Look at AAPL selloff just as Amazon was about to fall below SMA200 on the 1 minute... They continue to try to use AAPL as the source to prop all this. It will be fun to watch the AAPL earnings squeeze and the MOMO garbage get dumped from there on out... No way in the world MOMO #$%$ outperforms AAPL in Q2. The trade is already massively overextended...
It is painful to watch over and over again.

Except one day, when no one is expecting it because everyone has become so complacent, a real investor is going to decide to up to its entire position and buy AAPL because the relative valuation is so absurd. It will likely happen at Apple earnings. They'll need capital to buy shares and exercise the call options. It will have to come from somewhere and AMZN/momo scams will be the ideal source.

This dynamic will not make it through AAPL and AMZN's earnings this quarter. Funds will be scrambling to dump AMZN and buy AAPL throughout Q2 and the rest of the year. If you think AAPL fell hard when it lost momentum, AMZN will be a sight to see...
You mean like when I put on a new short after hours in the high $280's the last time. I laughed all the way to the bank on that sham. :-)

Funny thing is that a real investor with a sizeable position in both could abolutely bury (and I mean permanently) whoever has been playing the AAPLtrage game here. The risk/return is so skewed on both AAPL and AMZN that they could sell $ for $ straight through whatever is attempted to be bought. They could do it all the way up through AAPL at $500 and AMZN below $200. But, they could effectively exhange all Scamazon shares with intrinsic worth of somewhere around $100 for AAPL which is reasonably valued and has huge downside protection from its huge cash hoard...
